subject: probability
title: Geometric Distribution
contentHtml: The geometric distribution is a discrete probability distribution that models the number of trials until the first success in a series of independent and identically distributed Bernoulli trials.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we flip a fair coin until we get heads. What is the probability that it takes exactly 3 flips?

steps.description: Identify the probability of getting tails in each flip
steps.explanation: We need to find the probability of getting tails twice and then heads

intuition: The geometric distribution is memoryless, meaning that the number of trials until the first success only depends on the probability of success in each trial.
realWorldApplications: This distribution can be used to model waiting times in systems where failures are independent and identically distributed.
